Intro

Intro

Okay… I think when I started blogging, I‚Äôve started noticing the things I go through each week.

So, it is one of the advantages of blogging, I guess. (Cause no matter whoever said it ‚Äî I wouldn‚Äôt believe it. But when doing it ‚Äî it makes sense).

Let me dive in ‚Äî into this blog post‚Äôs topic! Which is something that happened in my life in the last two weeks. That‚Äôs why I mentioned blogging helps me remember when things happen.

Thus, the topic is:

Do not interfere or take sides when two individuals you love have a fight or misunderstanding.

Main Points

I won‚Äôt spill all the details, since it‚Äôs not my matter ‚Äî and I didn‚Äôt ask their permission to talk about it. But it was something between a loving father and a loving daughter. Both of them are amazing.

But one of them wanted a certain life decision, and the other couldn‚Äôt bear it ‚Äî since it wasn‚Äôt something they were satisfied with.

And I took the side of one of them ‚Äî maybe because I wanted to fix something that happened in the past. Yet‚Ä¶ it was the present moment!

Also, I took the side immediately, without really listening to the other side.

Plus ‚Äî things really escalated, my fears and anger got me blind.

  • Even worse ‚Äî I couldn‚Äôt do my daily tasks or at least live the way I want to.

To end this blog here, I‚Äôll just say: I‚Äôve learned the lesson and dis-attached myself from other people‚Äôs life experiences.

item.title: Why Some People Shouldn‚Äôt Have Kids!
item.description:
Intro

I don‚Äôt know much about motherhood ‚Äî but I do know it‚Äôs very hard. In this blog post, I‚Äôll try to explain where I stand on the matter, because for a long time, it has been one of my biggest fears.

Main Points

Growing up, I saw the difference between being just a parent-mother and being a real mother. A parent-mother only cares about bringing kids into the world. A mother, on the other hand, takes care of everything ‚Äî from a child‚Äôs appearance to their inner emotional and mental well-being.

After witnessing this contrast, I promised myself that I wouldn‚Äôt bring anyone into this world through me. Life continued to show me that parenting is not a game. And I believe these parent-mothers, who only focus on birthing children, often cause long-term harm.

Because when their kids grow up and start to wake up to reality, they go through grief ‚Äî some break down, others spend years just trying to figure themselves out, usually without any healthy emotional tools.

Here are a few real-life examples:

How to be okay with yourself: If your subconscious is wired to believe that you are the problem, it’s hard to feel peace.

How to understand and deal with fear: When your body and mind are used to living in constant fear, even peaceful moments feel like a trap.

How to trust yourself: This one is the hardest. You think you‚Äôve faced the issue and solved it ‚Äî but then something takes you back to square one, deeper into the original wound.

Finding a life partner: You may meet the right person ‚Äî but instead of building a calm future together, your unresolved wounds make the relationship full of unnecessary obstacles.

Conclusion

Let me define a few terms, from my point of view:

Parent-Mother: Someone only concerned with reproduction.

Mother: Someone who knows she can’t be everything, but chooses to seek help ‚Äî from the father, grandmothers, grandfathers, aunts, and uncles ‚Äî to raise her child in a healthy way. By telling them her way some they can conturbite right. She focuses on understanding rather than always being right.

That‚Äôs all for today. Just take it easy. üå±

item.title: What‚Äôs the Point of Living? ‚Äì A Follow-up with Philosophy
item.description:
Intro

Switching to a Saturday Blog!

I’ve decided to change my weekly blog from Friday to Saturday, simply because that’s what has been happening naturally for a while now.

Today‚Äôs blog is one of the possible answers to the question I asked last week: What Is the Point of Living?

Healing Through Philosophy - ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿØÿßŸàŸä ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÅŸÑÿ≥ŸÅÿ©

This book was a recommendation from an influencer I follow. Interestingly, when I studied Philosophy in university, I didn‚Äôt enjoy it much and barely remember what it was about. So, before even starting this book, I was skeptical.

I was actually searching for another book, but since I couldn‚Äôt find it in PDF format, I decided to give Healing Through Philosophy (ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿØÿßŸàŸä ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÅŸÑÿ≥ŸÅÿ©) a try. I had time to read while waiting for my brother at the dentist. T_T

üìñ Note: The book is in Arabic (my native language). I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs available in English or other languages.

The author, Saeed Nashid, did an amazing job using his own insights combined with ideas from notable philosophers.

The Chapter That Got Me: “Maybe We Don’t Need Hope”

In this chapter, Nashid references a story from The Book of Samuel II (Old Testament) about Prophet David and how he reacted when his son (before Solomon) was ill and later died. His followers were surprised by his shift in emotions‚Äîfrom distress to calmness. He explained that once his son passed away, he no longer had to witness his suffering. Instead, he found comfort in knowing that he would reunite with him in the afterlife.

The philosophical idea here is how hope can be a double-edged sword‚Äîit can motivate us, but it can also cause emotional suffering when things don‚Äôt turn out as we expect.

The book also references Jean-Jacques Rousseau, Friedrich Nietzsche, and Baruch Spinoza. Nietzsche, for example, pointed out that the ancient Greeks believed hope was the greatest evil‚Äîbecause it keeps people waiting instead of acting.

My Thoughts on Hope

This chapter hit me because nowadays, “hope” is marketed everywhere‚Äîin self-help books, social media, and even corporate culture.

But in reality, hope alone is not enough. Life isn‚Äôt a movie where everything magically works out. Most of our days are filled with routine, boredom, and occasional happiness‚Äîand too much hope can lead to disappointment when things don‚Äôt happen as expected.

Conclusion

This book gave me one possible answer to last week‚Äôs question. It presents a lifestyle perspective, where people try to define meaning in every aspect of life‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs happiness, career, love, or marriage.

It also helped me understand how ideas evolve over time‚Äîhow people in the past thought vs. how modern society thinks today.

But here‚Äôs my struggle: There are so many concepts in philosophy, and after understanding them, I have to decide how to apply them in my own life.

The book is short‚Äîso if you find it in your language, I highly recommend reading it!

Until next week, just take it easy. üòä

item.title: What Is the Point of Living? A Thoughtful Reflection
item.description:
Intro

I couldn‚Äôt write a blog last week because I was under the weather, struggling with seasonal flu. It wasn‚Äôt pleasant at all. I keep wondering‚Äîwhy does this happen? When I was younger and living in a different geographic location, I never experienced this.

But after moving to a new place, it started happening, and each time, it hit me hard. For years, I made sure to get a flu shot annually. However, last year, I thought, let me skip it and see what happens. Well, turns out, I couldn‚Äôt handle it. So, on Tuesday, I finally got the flu shot, and I‚Äôve been feeling much better in the past couple of days.

That was my little update, but now, let‚Äôs get into the real topic of this blog‚Äîsomething that‚Äôs been on my mind.

What Is the Point Of Living? or Having a Life?

I don‚Äôt know why, but this question keeps looping in my mind, especially when I‚Äôm sick. üòÖ

I still remember the first time it struck me‚Äîit was in my last year of high school. I kept thinking, No matter how long you live or how much you try to achieve, eventually, you‚Äôll end up in the grave. So what‚Äôs the point?

Maybe I was feeling down at the time because my educational path wasn‚Äôt clear. But even now, after finishing university, I still ask myself the same question. Sure, completing my degree made me happy, but did it dramatically change my life? Not really. It gave me some direction, like my goal to study abroad, but even if that doesn‚Äôt happen, life will just keep moving forward.

Let‚Äôs look at it from another angle‚Äîmarriage or work. We chase after them, but once we have them, they come with their own struggles. Being single or a freelancer isn‚Äôt necessarily easier; you become your own judge and prisoner to your thoughts.

Even having dreams and goals can feel heavy. When they don‚Äôt work out, you feel crushed. And when they do, sometimes they don‚Äôt bring the satisfaction you expected. So, what‚Äôs the point? Life will go on, no matter what.

So!!! What is what matters for reall?

Honestly? I don‚Äôt know. Some say it‚Äôs about the emotions you experience‚Äîthey change you. But even if you change, life itself doesn‚Äôt care.

Conclusion

Before anyone worries‚Äîno, I don‚Äôt have any intentions of ending my life, nor do I have any known mental health issues. I‚Äôm just asking a question that I think many people ask themselves at some point.

I‚Äôm not looking for an answer, because honestly, anyone who claims to have one is probably lying. Instead, I think the real challenge is finding a way to keep moving forward while still trying to make sense of everything.

For now, let‚Äôs just take it easy‚Äîuntil next time. ‚úåÔ∏è

item.title: How Anime Inspired My Passion for the Japanese Language | Part 2
item.description:
Intro

After the background of How Anime Inspired My Passion for the Japanese Language. In this blog post, I’ll share the resources that helped me learn the Japanese language for the self-study method.

At the end of this blog post, I’ll share my N5 test result… I got the result today morning 31 Jan 2025. And why I am doing the JLPT exam.

Resourses to help study Japanese:

Actually, as I begin to check what are the best resources for self-study or is good to just find a course online or attend a language course at a campus.

I’ll start with the latter since the first takes a lot to explain:

For face-to-face campus: There is an amazing university called NUML University, this uni specializes in Languages there are almost all languages that a person interested in can learn, and they provide various levels starting with certificates to diplomas also, some have Bachelor’s degrees and few have Master Degree. But first, check their website to know more.

But when it came to me, their times were not suitable for me because I was working. So, I said let me try self-study.

Self Study: I did my first online course for Japanese Language I did Marugoto for a while. Eventually, I decided last year in July that I would do the JLPT Exam, yet I was confused between N5 and N4 since N3 I felt there was a lot on me. In the end, my decision was N5.

So, I have missed the date for July 2024. I had to wait and apply for the Des 2024 Test. This gives me like 6 months to really prepare for the first time. I planned to check some videos on Youtube by people who have taken the exam, to create my plan:

  • Find a Study Book, I have picked from the two famous books Ginki and Mina no Nihon Go the latter. The Study book had everything but, I have put all the required Kanji for N5 in a section in my copy so I can memorize them in my free time, a section for every lesson grammar, and a section for vocabulary with answering book questions.

  • I have chosen to study for 4 hours but to behonest life won’t relieve you for it grap so when I could not I had to make up time to waste hours. I couldn’t finish the whole book before the exam, I have just finished 5 first lessons.

  • I did not focus on writing much and speaking since these skills are not tested in the exam, it’s a Muiltbull choice question, for Reading, Grammar, vocabulary, and lastly Listening.

Note You can enhance your skills of speaking and writing if you wish when preparing for the exam but you need to put extra time and effort. I couldn’t because my life experience is different from you all, and I respect it.

Please find the Links to resources in the Links Section I used to help me study the language on my own.

Conclusion

Now, after I have given you some brief about my studying plan I still choose learning by myself for my N3 JLPT. My reason for studying Japanese it may sound silly but I want to watch anime without subtitles and as I am trying to find an opportunity to complete my higher studies in Japan, I want to be comfortable with the language.

My result of the 1st Des 2024 Exam as shown, it shows that I did not pass! But considering everything I have mentioned above, I see an achievement and I don’t want to bring the maximum score I want the passing which is 80. Yet, I couldn’t have them this time.

Finally, My plan now is to prepare for N3 as I have a whole year to prepare for the exam. And if I did not pass that one I’ll repeat it till I get the passing score.

Just take it easy.

I began watching first with Korean Drama; Coffee Prince my all-time favorite. Then Boys Before Flowers… and some that I don’t remember now. It helped me gain new words every day cause Korean I wasn’t understand so, I checked the subtitles to know what happening.
